meanings.definition: A girl or woman who delivers or sells newspapers.
meanings.sent1: The newsgirls on our street always greet us with a smile when they deliver the newspapers.
meanings.sent2: I saw a newsgirl selling newspapers on the corner of the busy intersection.
meanings.sent3: The newsgirls decided to have a race to see who could deliver the papers the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The newsgirls were like busy bees buzzing around the neighborhood with their newspapers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the newsgirls carrying stacks of newspapers will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A group of girls or women who work as journalists reporting news.
meanings.sent1: The newsgirls at the press conference asked insightful questions to the politicians.
meanings.sent2: I admire the dedication of the newsgirls who work tirelessly to report the latest news.
meanings.sent3: The newsgirls celebrated their successful news coverage with a pizza party in the newsroom.
meanings.sent4: The newsgirls' pens were like swords, ready to battle misinformation with truth.
meanings.sent5: The newsgirls' determination to uncover the truth shines brightly in their reporting.
